contentrichtext.text: '''Ghulam Mohammad''' may refer to: '''Note''': Ghulam Mohammad is also spelled as Ghulam Mohammed, Ghulam Muhammad, Ghulam Muhammed, Gholam Mohammad, Gulam Mohammad etc. * [[Ghulam Mohammed (composer)]], an Indian film score composer * [[Ghulam Mohammed Abdul Khader]] (died 1993), the seventh prince of the House of Arcot * [[Ghulam Muhammad A. Fecto]], the Founder and Chairman of FECTO Group of Industries * [[Ghulam Mohammed Baloch]], a Baloch nationalist politician * [[Ghulam Mohammad Farhad]] (1901–1984), an Afghan engineer and Pashtun nationalist * [[Ghulam Muhammad Ghouse Khan]] (c. 1824–1855), the twelfth and last Nawab of the Carnatic * [[Gholam Nousher]] (born 1964), a former Bangladeshi cricketer * [[Ghulam Muhammad Qasir]], a poet from Pakistan. * [[Ghulam Mohammed Sadiq]], former Prime Minister of Jammu and Kashmir * [[Ghulam Mohammad Saznawaz]], a Master of Kashmiri Sufiyana Music * [[Ghulam Mohammad Shah]] (1920–2009), an Indian politician and former Chief Minister of Jammu and Kashmir * [[Ghulam Mohammed Sheikh]] (born 1937), an internationally renowned painter, writer and art critic '''Others''' * [[Muhammad Ghulam Tawab]] (Air Vice Marshal) (1930–1999), the second chief of the air staff of Bangladesh Air Force * [[Ghulam Muhammad Khan]] (1763–1828), briefly Nawab of Rampur * [[Bakshi Ghulam Mohammad]] (1907–1972), ruled the State of Jammu and Kashmir as Prime Minister * [[Ghulam Muhammad Ali Khan]] (1882–1952), the fifth Prince of Arcot * [[Ghulam Muhammad Malik]] (Lieutenant General), former commander of the X Corps, Rawalpindi of the Pakistan Army * [[Malik Ghulam Muhammad]], former Governor-General of Pakistan * [[Mir Ghulam Mohammad Ghobar]] (1898–1978), a historian, journalist, political figure, and a poet from Afghanistan * [[Mirza Ghulam Moinuddin Muhammad Javaid Jah Bahadur]], succeeded his father as head of the descendants of Timurid Dynasty the former ruling dynasty of the Mughal Empire * [[Nawab Sayyid Ghulam Muhammad Ali Khan I Bahadur]] (died 1825), twice Nawab of Banganapalle in India * [[Ghulam Muhammad Khan Mahar]], Sardar (died April 9, 1995), a Pakistani politician * [[Ghulam Muhammad Tarzi]], Sardar, a former ruler (considered Governor) of Baluchistan * [[Ghulam Muhammad Sultan Sahib]], Shahzada, (1795–1872), the fourteenth son of Tipu Sultan, the Indian warrior-emperor of Mysore ==See also== * [[Kot Ghulam Muhammad]] * [[Ghulam Muhammadabad]] * [[Ghulam (disambiguation)]] * [[Mohammad]] {{hndis|Mohammad, Ghulam}}
